page.title: 08Housing in Rogate
page.content: The houses in the centre of the village are all different but those on the council estate are mostly the same design. Some in the middle of the village are made of stone, those on the estate are made of concrete. The newest ones have lots of large windows, that was the fashion when they were built in the 1960s. Sliding windows can still be seen which suggest these places were built before the 18th century. Some roofs are made out of tiles or slates but several have thatch. East Lodge is a sheltered housing building with lots of flats for old people, a resident warden helps them. All the homes have well tended gardens with gay, brightly coloured flowers. Rogate has won the best kept village at least twice. It came third this year.
